reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 18:33:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "Do not use instance.id in the name property

The ability to have an instance name rely on the 'id' field is a horrid
thing that has been allowed to continue for too long. This comes to a
head with cellsv2 work for two reasons:

1. An instance does not have an 'id' until it is in a cell db, and the
   'id' is generated by the receiving db, so it can not be used for name
   generation in the boot request response.

2. With multiple cells the 'id's will not be unique any longer. This
   means that any reliance on a monotonically increasing int in the name is
   going to break anyways. And that was never an intended feature.

In order to keep deployers from needing to change their
instance_name_template if it uses 'id' this patch simply uses the uuid
anywhere that 'id' would be used.

Change-Id: Iee5aa74c181211513ba76d2d93b58fb805bd5d6f
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use instance.id in the name property

The ability to have an instance name rely on the 'id' field is a horrid
thing that has been allowed to continue for too long. This comes to a
head with cellsv2 work for two reasons:

1. An instance does not have an 'id' until it is in a cell db, and the
   'id' is generated by the receiving db, so it can not be used for name
   generation in the boot request response.

2. With multiple cells the 'id's will not be unique any longer. This
   means that any reliance on a monotonically increasing int in the name is
   going to break anyways. And that was never an intended feature.

In order to keep deployers from needing to change their
instance_name_template if it uses 'id' this patch simply uses the uuid
anywhere that 'id' would be used.

Change-Id: Iee5aa74c181211513ba76d2d93b58fb805bd5d6f

commit_message:
Tempest image clients use version in URL

Tempest image clients specify the version in each URL of each
method instead of using api_version at class level, which provides
support for both versioned and unversioned enpoints in the
catalog.

Change-Id: Id7883936b5a7ff13dc71fff307a5322c63221ad5
Closes-bug: #1130387

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-07 07:16:23.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_clusters.py', 'senlin/api/openstack/v1/clusters.py', 'senlin/tests/tempest/api/clusters/test_cluster_update_negative.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_profiles.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/api/openstack/v1/test_clusters.py'], 'message': "Minor revise cluster_update and profile_update

This patch revises cluster_update and profile_update service
call to make them raise badrequest exception when being
invoked without giving any property to be updated.
Also default cluster timeout is now specified in cluster_create
service call rather than in API layer if it is not provided
when cluster_create API is invoked. And cluster_update
actually don't need default timeout input value.

Change-Id: Ied2adfc676da4b8c4e3e89f41001f460982c39bb
"}]
commit_message:
Minor revise cluster_update and profile_update

This patch revises cluster_update and profile_update service
call to make them raise badrequest exception when being
invoked without giving any property to be updated.
Also default cluster timeout is now specified in cluster_create
service call rather than in API layer if it is not provided
when cluster_create API is invoked. And cluster_update
actually don't need default timeout input value.

Change-Id: Ied2adfc676da4b8c4e3e89f41001f460982c39bb

commit_message:
Prevent creating kernel and ramdisk ids with 'None' value

This commit prevents convertion of None values to 'None'
strings for kernel_id and ramdisk_id, since glance v2
image schema forbids it.

The properties of images previously created as 'None' strings
are converted to None.

Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I06eef936004ae83f1805abeb422adcf9078fbc79
Closes-bug: #1539698

commit_message:
Minor revise profile_update API

The patch revises profile_update API to make it raise
BadRequest exception when user tries to update profile Spec.
This is for keeping consistent with policy_update API.

Change-Id: I8da796c7dd6f308713883af9b8889241d796bd7d

For non-type-versioned request we allow to sort

from v2 are used as defaults.

This code fixes it by setting the correct set of keys.

commit_message:
Fix default sort keys in v3

For non-type-versioned request we allow to sort
artifact list by available base properties only.
But current implementation is wrong because keys
from v2 are used as defaults.

This code fixes it by setting the correct set of keys.

FastTrack
ApiImpact
Closes-Bug: #1490600

Change-Id: I63d914b5e823bd5f809c3c96fac1265341646441

commit_message:
Make Xenplugin to work with glance v2 api

This code makes xenplugin version agnostic and
allows to work with both apis, depending on what
version is considered as 'current'
Plugin version is bumped to 1.4.

Related to blueprint use-glance-v2-api

Change-Id: I368d1362eb19713b0f84b940f9d25a1caf78b03b

commit_message:
Remove version hardcoding for 'create' and 'update' methods

This patch continues the big initiative to make Nova
adopt Glance v2 API. In this patch 'create' and 'update'
methods are improved to work with both versions.

Depends-On: Id0f1c398b8b48f2ffc2488b29bc7cbd279069337
Depends-On: I2bd454990d90f60b0d6505d56c9ce23836e82e3b
Related to blueprint use-glance-v2-api

Change-Id: Idcd98327480c35c4f1dbe0656b87b57df9a85ef2

adopt Glance v2 API. In this patch 'detail', 'download'
and 'delete' methods are improved to work with both versions.

commit_message:
gpfs: Add changed options for 'find' command in rootwrap filters

Recently the 'find' command has been changed in gpfs driver
with a commit with change ID Id26cb59d88082971465c8fcf0c150c858ab3bced.
Adding the changed options in the rootwrap filters.

Change-Id: I3fde14949db57f89d7fa5e265a67d1d2d7884053
Closes-bug: 1581670
(cherry picked from commit b48614f2485c26f020781f815918ff198690e6a9)

commit_message:
Tests fail silently when curl is not installed

If curl program is not installed, the script prepare_nailgun.sh
will fail in the fuel-client tests without giving any message.
This commit will add the reason why the test failed.

Change-Id: I747beefc2747e0fc8e5e4c87cf9561796585de96
Closes-Bug: #1566250

commit_message:
Require auth for version api call

The version call may contain information that should not be publicly
discloused without authentication. This change removes the version call
from the public urls which will cause it to require authentication
before responding with version information.

Change-Id: I7352f83ec67321a1fb5caa75fc9168cc01229083
Closes-Bug: #1585137

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-20 15:55:54.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Let setup.py compile_catalog process all language files

Two years ago the translation files have been split into several
files, separating the log messages of different log levels from each
other, like X.pot, X-log-warning.pot, X-log-info.pot, and so on.
However, the setup.py command `compile_catalogs`, that comes from the
babel package and compiles the corresponding .po files into .mo
files, only supported one file per python package.  This means that
during packaging `compile_catalogs` never compiled the X-log-*.po
files, so the corresponding translations were always missing.

Since babel 2.3 the domain can be set to a space separated list of
domains.  This change adds the the additional log level files to the
domain list.

The obsolete check that .po and .pot files are valid is removed from
tox.ini.

Change-Id: I1f0bfb181e2b84ac6dd0ce61881cd2cc4400bdcb
Closes-Bug: #1536226
'}]
commit_message:
Let setup.py compile_catalog process all language files

Two years ago the translation files have been split into several
files, separating the log messages of different log levels from each
other, like X.pot, X-log-warning.pot, X-log-info.pot, and so on.
However, the setup.py command `compile_catalogs`, that comes from the
babel package and compiles the corresponding .po files into .mo
files, only supported one file per python package.  This means that
during packaging `compile_catalogs` never compiled the X-log-*.po
files, so the corresponding translations were always missing.

Since babel 2.3 the domain can be set to a space separated list of
domains.  This change adds the the additional log level files to the
domain list.

The obsolete check that .po and .pot files are valid is removed from
tox.ini.

Change-Id: I1f0bfb181e2b84ac6dd0ce61881cd2cc4400bdcb
Closes-Bug: #1536226

Implement Nova base profile

This patch implements the base for Nova profiles.
It's a first iteration to deploy Nova using composable roles.

Implements: blueprint refactor-puppet-manifests

commit_message:
Support error handling for "port delete" command

"Port delete" command supported deleting multi ports
before but didn't support error handing, This patch
add the error handling following the rules in
doc/source/command-errors.rst.

Change-Id: I4ea69f2279763626d6a27cad1ca0ee99822d016d
Partially-Implements: blueprint multi-argument-network

commit_message:
update corresponding filter cases caused by output changed

Since the LOG.output translates the message is delayed to be
handled by logging code, so the message got from mock_log.
call_args is not translated. we should force translating it
beforce assertIn.

Change-Id: I007d6580266c4749993fc30f9126ee0c6d2cec06

commit_message:
Change the default Fuel's Keystone token expiration

The amount of time a token remains valid should be decreased to
reduce potential security risks. This commit changes the defaults
to 6 hours. Also, this commit contains some styling cleanups.

Change-Id: I8563f89a1165d1f423ef59a86fab0f95a8444a25
Closes-Bug: #1585130
(cherry picked from commit e1d437d51b19ced80ff99feacaf2e07b2aa83327)

commit_message:
Remove hardcoding namespaces for monitors

This patchset removes the need of hardcoding the monitor
namespaces inside the monitor init code.

The monitor namespaces are derived from the CONF options for
monitors instead. This allows us to not hardcode anything in
the monitor init code while new monitors are added.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: I37cd2d6850801999887b9f5a1ed7245a5f0618cc

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-06-06 15:37:18.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_node_attributes.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_node_attributes_validator.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/deployment_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_cpu_distribution.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/settings.yaml', 'nailgun/nailgun/consts.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/network_manager/serializers/neutron_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/policy/cpu_distribution.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/task/task.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_verify_networks_task_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_task_deploy.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/network_manager/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/network_manager/validators/network.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/policy/hugepages_distribution.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/network_manager/tests/test_verify_node_interface_update.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/network_manager/managers/neutron.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_hugepages_distribution.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer_90.py'], 'message': "Change CPU distribution

CPU distribution mechanism should be changed due
to incorect requirements to nova and dpdk CPUs allocation

Changes:
 * Change CPU distribution
 * Add function for recognizing DPDK NICs for node
 * Remove requirement of enabled hugepages for
   DPDK NICs (it's checked before deployment)
 * Change HugePages distribution. Now it take into
   account Nova CPUs placement

Requirements Before:
 DPDK's CPUs should be located on the same NUMAs as
 Nova CPUs

Requirements Now:
 1. DPDK component CPU pinning has two parts:
     * OVS pmd core CPUs - These CPUs must be placed on the
       NUMAs where DPDK NIC is located. Since DPDK NIC can
       handle about 12 Mpps/s and 1 CPU can handle about
       3 Mpps/s there is no necessity to place more than
       4 CPUs per NIC. Let's name all remained CPUs as
       additional CPUs.
     * OVS Core CPUs - 1 CPU is enough and that CPU should
       be taken from any NUMA where at least 1 OVS pmd core
       CPU is located

 2. To improve Nova and DPDK performance, all additional CPUs
    should be distributed along with Nova's CPUs as
    OVS pmd core CPUs.

Change-Id: Ib2adf39c36b2e1536bb02b07fd8b5af50e3744b2
Closes-Bug: #1584006
"}]
commit_message:
Change CPU distribution

CPU distribution mechanism should be changed due
to incorect requirements to nova and dpdk CPUs allocation

Changes:
 * Change CPU distribution
 * Add function for recognizing DPDK NICs for node
 * Remove requirement of enabled hugepages for
   DPDK NICs (it's checked before deployment)
 * Change HugePages distribution. Now it take into
   account Nova CPUs placement

Requirements Before:
 DPDK's CPUs should be located on the same NUMAs as
 Nova CPUs

Requirements Now:
 1. DPDK component CPU pinning has two parts:
     * OVS pmd core CPUs - These CPUs must be placed on the
       NUMAs where DPDK NIC is located. Since DPDK NIC can
       handle about 12 Mpps/s and 1 CPU can handle about
       3 Mpps/s there is no necessity to place more than
       4 CPUs per NIC. Let's name all remained CPUs as
       additional CPUs.
     * OVS Core CPUs - 1 CPU is enough and that CPU should
       be taken from any NUMA where at least 1 OVS pmd core
       CPU is located

 2. To improve Nova and DPDK performance, all additional CPUs
    should be distributed along with Nova's CPUs as
    OVS pmd core CPUs.

Change-Id: Ib2adf39c36b2e1536bb02b07fd8b5af50e3744b2
Closes-Bug: #1584006

subject: Don't overwrite ceph osd_journal_size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 09:26:14.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/hieradata/ceph.yaml'], 'message': "Don't overwrite ceph osd_journal_size

The default journal size is 5 gigs. This change stops us
overwriting it with 1 gig that is too small for production.

The config value is used by ceph only when it creates the
journal so this does not affect upgrades.

Change-Id: I4bfd2ab47e131d8fcdd5dc75a5a56cfae8b22d5a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't overwrite ceph osd_journal_size

The default journal size is 5 gigs. This change stops us
overwriting it with 1 gig that is too small for production.

The config value is used by ceph only when it creates the
journal so this does not affect upgrades.

Change-Id: I4bfd2ab47e131d8fcdd5dc75a5a56cfae8b22d5a

commit_message:
catch DriverLoadFailure for get_transport optional

new oslo.messaging 5.2.0 release will raise
oslo_messaging.transport.DriverLoadFailure if no existent transport
driver, hence breaks our code and unit test as well.

This patch fixes it by adding DriverLoadFailure to catch list.

Also:

tempest: import ImagesClient as ImagesClientV2

This commit [1] renamed ImagesClientV2 to ImagesClient so Ceilometer
Tempest tests do not work anymore.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/2fea405bd6ea8674c8daaf8ebb788ae33d52c976

Change-Id: I02b5d1b3f4a9169cbf428a5eff9c6705494741af
Closes-Bug: #1588151
(cherry picked from commit d7f8ce94e433da8af3660ecf52715a04c221fde5)
(cherry picked from commit f6b2406fffdd4deae508b9f251691fe9b70cb1ee)

commit_message:
[GATE UNBLOCKER] Lock CPU map script to a release

The CPU map script from devstack has been removed upstream.
This needs to be locked down to ensure we're not using the head
of master when depending on this script.

Upstream commit where the script was removed: [0].

To stablize the gate the script has been locked down using the a
SHA from the "stable/kilo" branch within upstream "devstack/tools" [1].

[0] - https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/214459cdf776a77dacd70a9205c5b8a6ceaff31a
[1] - http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/plain/tools/cpu_map_update.py?h=a631abadde7346b49fab5b2ac16561dff77050d7

Change-Id: I0d55e799e4b4caff502438747fc65729dcaefd7e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 08ae3501d84d720a48c6c5a7fc0affa04b751d2e)

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-03 13:13:21.000000000', 'files': ['doc/networking-guide/source/misc-neutron-purge.rst'], 'message': '[network] Improve neutron purge

This patch makes additions to the neutron purge page to clarify
that the command can be used with tenants that have been deleted
or otherwise do not exist in keystone.

It also documents the expected output when no supported resources
are found.

backport: mitaka
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1580440
Change-Id: I562eb081630e124d690c27ae16d13f9793c5cafe
'}]
commit_message:
[network] Improve neutron purge

This patch makes additions to the neutron purge page to clarify
that the command can be used with tenants that have been deleted
or otherwise do not exist in keystone.

It also documents the expected output when no supported resources
are found.

backport: mitaka
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1580440
Change-Id: I562eb081630e124d690c27ae16d13f9793c5cafe

commit_message:
Update docs for latest VMware interoperability

* Minimum vCenter version should be 5.1.0.
* The preferred command line is openstack not glance
* vmware_linked_clone is legacy in favor of img_linked_clone

Change-Id: Ib75355998d76e528a487fbcdc577662dd820179b

subject: [networking-guide] Change l3 ha config in dvr_ha_snat
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 167, 'name': 'Christian Berendt', 'email': 'berendt@osism.tech', 'username': 'berendt'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 9162, 'name': 'Lana Brindley', 'email': 'openstack@lanabrindley.com', 'username': 'loquacity'}, {'_account_id': 9515, 'name': 'Matthew Kassawara', 'email': 'mkassawara@gmail.com', 'username': 'ionosphere80'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 10897, 'name': 'Joseph Robinson', 'email': 'josephremail@gmail.com', 'username': 'RobiJoe'}, {'_account_id': 12860, 'name': 'Dongcan Ye', 'email': 'yedongcan@yeah.net', 'username': 'yedongcan'}, {'_account_id': 14151, 'name': 'ziyu032', 'email': 'chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net', 'username': 'ziyu032'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-07 00:17:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/networking-guide/source/adv-config-dvr-ha-snat.rst'], 'message': '[networking-guide] Change l3 ha config in dvr_ha_snat

The fix include:
1.In the guide, ha_confs_path is DevStack path, Neutron default
ha_confs_path is $state_path/ha_confs, we do not need to make
an extra directory store it.
2.Remove another two default configurations for ha vrrp.
3.Remove no longer exist conf router_delete_namespaces.
4.Change entrypoint name for OVSInterfaceDriver.

Change-Id: I9ff5fb538d1b69b0ad091fde6644e110607007ed
'}]
commit_message:
[networking-guide] Change l3 ha config in dvr_ha_snat

The fix include:
1.In the guide, ha_confs_path is DevStack path, Neutron default
ha_confs_path is $state_path/ha_confs, we do not need to make
an extra directory store it.
2.Remove another two default configurations for ha vrrp.
3.Remove no longer exist conf router_delete_namespaces.
4.Change entrypoint name for OVSInterfaceDriver.

Change-Id: I9ff5fb538d1b69b0ad091fde6644e110607007ed

commit_message:
Skip Flask 0.11

The new 0.11.0 release broke Octavia unit tests. While we clarify the
culprit of the breakage, let's use the known good version of the
library.

Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt
	upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I26068f2282b9ab7e89dbe2b6877a0a894833204c
Related-Bug: #1587849
(cherry picked from commit 4980942cadbaaa51b4c3d2452dfa30a2d538ea4b)

commit_message:
Add ability to remove members from endpoints and interfaces hashes

into network_scheme.

All subhashes into interfaces and endpoints may be overrided by nil
or empty string values.

+ tests

Closes-bug: #1588934
Change-Id: I271c17b6fa70cd975fa98a1aa4edd4d7042b0d21

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[GATE UNBLOCKER] Lock CPU map script to a release

The CPU map script from devstack has been removed upstream.
This needs to be locked down to ensure we're not using the head
of master when depending on this script.

Upstream commit where the script was removed: [0].

To stablize the gate the script has been locked down using the a
SHA from the "master" branch within upstream "devstack/tools" [1].

[0] - https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/214459cdf776a77dacd70a9205c5b8a6ceaff31a
[1] - http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/plain/tools/cpu_map_update.py?h=65dfb9ef651785a0000bf47d6d82df9ca07eb412

Change-Id: I0d55e799e4b4caff502438747fc65729dcaefd7e
Depends-On: I198db581db22655dc8791ba40a77a39b362c1b73
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Increase tempest baremetal deploy/unprovision timeouts

This patch increase deploy/unprovision timeouts for ironic grenade jobs.
Grenade job launches smoke tempest tests, that builds several instances in
parallel, as result deploy/unprovision timeout should be increased for them.

Closes-Bug: #1580994

Change-Id: Id2856f4366744b2fc187b86a4d0d1db1e4b7c964
Depends-On: Idd454b7dea2a6d37a6bc048132fc2b3765d37429

commit_message:
Import os-http into openstack infrastructure

os-http is a CLI for making raw http requests against OpenStack services
for development purposes. It handles the standard authentication and
discovery process so that you can focus on the response.

Allows a request to be passed to the lbaas API that contains the full graph
structure of a load balancer.  This means that an entire load balancer graph
can be created in one POST to the API, or a partial graph can be.

This creates a new driver method to the driver interface that when implemented
will be called when a full or partial graph is attempted to be created.  If
the driver does not implement this method, then the request is not allowed.

Co-Author: Trevor Vardeman <trevor.vardeman@rackspace.com>

Closes-Bug: #1463202
Depends-On: Id3a5ddb8efded8c6ad72a7118424ec01c777318d
Change-Id: Ic16ca4cb3cb407d9e91eea74315a39bf86c654f3
'}]
commit_message:
Get Me A LB

Allows a request to be passed to the lbaas API that contains the full graph
structure of a load balancer.  This means that an entire load balancer graph
can be created in one POST to the API, or a partial graph can be.

This creates a new driver method to the driver interface that when implemented
will be called when a full or partial graph is attempted to be created.  If
the driver does not implement this method, then the request is not allowed.

Co-Author: Trevor Vardeman <trevor.vardeman@rackspace.com>

Closes-Bug: #1463202
Depends-On: Id3a5ddb8efded8c6ad72a7118424ec01c777318d
Change-Id: Ic16ca4cb3cb407d9e91eea74315a39bf86c654f3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-07 00:03:52.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Migrate tripleo to centos-7"

This reverts commit 791021c4b902b84ecabce30fa223039cd69b5948.

We tried this migration today and seem to be having a variety of
job failures and timeouts ever since. Lets revert for now to fix
CI and then we can perhaps try to switch back once we've done
more Centos 7 testing.

Change-Id: I83a2de65b624ded850a974a18c532b470a1ec97c
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Migrate tripleo to centos-7"

This reverts commit 791021c4b902b84ecabce30fa223039cd69b5948.

We tried this migration today and seem to be having a variety of
job failures and timeouts ever since. Lets revert for now to fix
CI and then we can perhaps try to switch back once we've done
more Centos 7 testing.

Change-Id: I83a2de65b624ded850a974a18c532b470a1ec97c

The amqp 2.0 is not backwards compatible with kombu driver of
oslo.messaging. All functional tests of kombu driver are fails with:

commit_message:
Fix the broken amqp version

The amqp 2.0 is not backwards compatible with kombu driver of
oslo.messaging. All functional tests of kombu driver are fails with:
AttributeError: 'Connection' object has no attribute '_frame_writer'

Closes-Bug: #1586840

Change-Id: If7e130a70f31a2eb1d9df6b5f46f88c90880e254

commit_message:
Using LOG.warning instead of LOG.warn

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Iac71d0c6d4209c236f4a4149eec0d08ec1682271

commit_message:
Move _format_volume_id() outside of take_action() method in VolumeV2

There are two reasons to move it:
1.To keep consistent with other commands.
2.We need to call _format_volume_id() method in unit test,so we
should not let it in the take_action() method.

Change-Id: I98fee5e416fa55c1c6ddddb466342f972d611a14

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-24 17:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_common.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_storwize_svc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_fc.py'], 'message': 'Storwize: terminate_connetion NPIV perf improvement

When terminate connection is called on a VM that is using
NPIV connections while the VM is shutdown such as when the
the VM is being deleted, the NPIV ports are no longer logged
into the fabric and the lsfabric fast path will not find the VM.
Add a fast path this NPIV case is to first check the host names
from the list of hosts that have mapped the volume before
exhaustively searching the entire host list for a match

Fixed an issue with the simulator not resetting lshost after
the simulated condition fired.

Added a new UT to cover the code change.

Change-Id: Ie38fb708ad7eae62261e71ab0bcb505c3efdb3b1
Closes-Bug: #1580342
'}]
commit_message:
Storwize: terminate_connetion NPIV perf improvement

When terminate connection is called on a VM that is using
NPIV connections while the VM is shutdown such as when the
the VM is being deleted, the NPIV ports are no longer logged
into the fabric and the lsfabric fast path will not find the VM.
Add a fast path this NPIV case is to first check the host names
from the list of hosts that have mapped the volume before
exhaustively searching the entire host list for a match

Fixed an issue with the simulator not resetting lshost after
the simulated condition fired.

Added a new UT to cover the code change.

Change-Id: Ie38fb708ad7eae62261e71ab0bcb505c3efdb3b1
Closes-Bug: #1580342

commit_message:
Fix errors for "volume type unset" command

Normally, we can unset multi properties but the "volume type unset"
command could not, because the action "append" was missed. So I add
it and also fix the unit test and doc in this patch.

Change-Id: I20470f2b7bb2a8d7f292cea498826669c3418c77

subject: Fix required_api_versions validator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 21:59:46.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/validation.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_validation.py'], 'message': "Fix required_api_versions validator

This makes two changes:

* When the validator is configured to require either Keystone v2.0 or
  Keystone v3, it actually works now. Before that made it always fail.
* The validator attempts to read component versions from context;
  otherwise it was impossible to run a non-Keystone scnario with a
  required version on a cluster with multiple API versions
  enabled. (E.g., you couldn't require Glance v2 for a scenario and
  run it on a cluster with both Glance v1 and v2 enabled.)

Test coverage is also expanded and tests are reorganized.

Change-Id: I996f789a86e6e74562fe8b3b1eab60b67b0b9fa7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix required_api_versions validator

This makes two changes:

* When the validator is configured to require either Keystone v2.0 or
  Keystone v3, it actually works now. Before that made it always fail.
* The validator attempts to read component versions from context;
  otherwise it was impossible to run a non-Keystone scnario with a
  required version on a cluster with multiple API versions
  enabled. (E.g., you couldn't require Glance v2 for a scenario and
  run it on a cluster with both Glance v1 and v2 enabled.)

Test coverage is also expanded and tests are reorganized.

Change-Id: I996f789a86e6e74562fe8b3b1eab60b67b0b9fa7

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-06-06 21:46:04.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_actions.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_image_metadata.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_list_image_filters.py', 'tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_actions.py'], 'message': 'Check which glance client version to use

Nova is working toward supporting the glance v2 API which will
allow disabling the glance v1 API in glance in a deployment and
configuring Nova to only use the glance v2 API.

The existing API and scenario tests are setting up a base test image
using the glance v1 client regardless of whether or not the glance v1
API is enabled in tempest.conf.

This adds a check to the tests to see which glance client version
to use depending on the config.

Change-Id: I1b1dc2911698d4e4d1a2727902ba457688d88752
Closes-Bug: #1589093
'}]
commit_message:
Check which glance client version to use

Nova is working toward supporting the glance v2 API which will
allow disabling the glance v1 API in glance in a deployment and
configuring Nova to only use the glance v2 API.

The existing API and scenario tests are setting up a base test image
using the glance v1 client regardless of whether or not the glance v1
API is enabled in tempest.conf.

This adds a check to the tests to see which glance client version
to use depending on the config.

Change-Id: I1b1dc2911698d4e4d1a2727902ba457688d88752
Closes-Bug: #1589093

Those are needed to accommodate to API request needs without handling

Instead of adding four new arguments to get_objects interface, they are

_pager argument. The name uses underscore to avoid breaking objects that

commit_message:
objects: support advanced criteria for get_objects

Those are needed to accommodate to API request needs without handling
sorting or pagination in Python.

Instead of adding four new arguments to get_objects interface, they are
consolidated using a single Pager object that is passed through the
_pager argument. The name uses underscore to avoid breaking objects that
want to pass 'pager' filter into SQLAlchemy. Hopefully, no objects will
ever have '_pager' attribute in their models.

Related-Bug: #1541928
Change-Id: I7dafc4dbd80f0ac35dbc2c2f30e56e441f5b1fc0

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-06 15:50:28.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/files/debs/ironic'], 'message': "remove neutron stuff from devstack deb packages

It seems we are enforcing certain dependencies to be always installed on
behalf of other projects.  The issue I'm facing is we unconditionally
install openvswitch-datapath-dkms which isn't necessary for Ubuntu kernels
>= 3.13.  Even worse, this package isn't available on Ubuntu 16.4 LTS thus
breaking devstack setup.sh on that platform.

This patch removes Neutron dependencies as those are handled by devstack[1]
and devstack neutron plugin[2]

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/files/debs/openvswitch#L3
[2] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base#L58

Closes-bug: #1580101

Change-Id: Iff0cf13499d9cb05f241f23759d5faec9a9c4a98
"}]
commit_message:
remove neutron stuff from devstack deb packages

It seems we are enforcing certain dependencies to be always installed on
behalf of other projects.  The issue I'm facing is we unconditionally
install openvswitch-datapath-dkms which isn't necessary for Ubuntu kernels
>= 3.13.  Even worse, this package isn't available on Ubuntu 16.4 LTS thus
breaking devstack setup.sh on that platform.

This patch removes Neutron dependencies as those are handled by devstack[1]
and devstack neutron plugin[2]

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/files/debs/openvswitch#L3
[2] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base#L58

Closes-bug: #1580101

Change-Id: Iff0cf13499d9cb05f241f23759d5faec9a9c4a98

Our manage_existing_snapshot code was checking for failure by
checking if the result was a taskflow.utils.misc.Failure instance.
This class was deprecated some time ago and has now been removed
in the latest 2.0 TaskFlow release with TaskFlow
commit afbfe77a7f7bad87c3e95b4f0c94cab84258a5bb.

Switched over to using the newer and correct

Closes-bug: #1588584

commit_message:
Switch to using correct TaskFlow Failure class

Our manage_existing_snapshot code was checking for failure by
checking if the result was a taskflow.utils.misc.Failure instance.
This class was deprecated some time ago and has now been removed
in the latest 2.0 TaskFlow release with TaskFlow
commit afbfe77a7f7bad87c3e95b4f0c94cab84258a5bb.

Switched over to using the newer and correct
taskflow.types.failure.Failure class.

Change-Id: I0f427b31ce25e4991ba7c32e65cb56ed575ea20d
Closes-bug: #1588584

commit_message:
Add equality operator to policy.RuleDefault

There are occasions when comparing two RuleDefault objects is needed.
Rather than embedding the logic at the comparison site it's preferable
to let the object know how to compare itself to another.

commit_message:
a depth in `get topology show` API can only be used
if there is a root

using vitrage in env without any root graph, unable to request
topology of type graph. A depth in `get topology show` API can
only be used if there is a root.

Change-Id: I4267037748f09e08ad3a3de76367ec5c8f055e8c
Fixes: bug #1586249
Signed-off-by: dongwenjuan <dong.wenjuan@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Fix Ceilometer tests config options

Ceilometer tempest tests have been moved to plugin but config options
were renamed as same were registered by Tempest also.

Now Tempest is removing ceilometer tests and related config options
- I0775bcc15dc9cbae6e075fe92f44b5f6c9b9d5d2
we need to fix their name back to original one to avoid backward incompatibility.

Congress use those in ceilometer integration tests and will break if we
do not rename those back to original one.

Change-Id: Id10cd260d12eba5b4f4d7798dee64fc62a92eb1c
Depends-On: I0775bcc15dc9cbae6e075fe92f44b5f6c9b9d5d2

The Nova v2 API code has been completely removed from Nova by
change[1]. Although Nova still supports v2 compatible API with the
legacy endpoint, it is better to switch to use Nova v2.1 in Heat.

commit_message:
Migrate to nova api version 2.1

The Nova v2 API code has been completely removed from Nova by
change[1]. Although Nova still supports v2 compatible API with the
legacy endpoint, it is better to switch to use Nova v2.1 in Heat.

This change sets version='2.1' when init novaclient
instance, then we can use novaclient v2 and will
use nova api v2.1.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311653/

Change-Id: I428abb4ca05847da8ffc2da7157aa5c34263a205
Closes-Bug: #1588155
Partial-Bug: #1588171

commit_message:
Pure project admin can't view Projects page

With Domains enabled, if you create a Project, with a user
who is an admin on that project (but not a domain admin),
the Identity > Projects panel will return a 500 error.

Change-Id: I6e3bf7ab8deb86a7f051e3600a6e99ce36a4fe9f
Closes-bug: #1587951

subject: Keystone uwsgi performance tuning
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}, {'_account_id': 21465, 'name': 'Mikhail Nikolaenko', 'email': 'mnikolaenko@protonmail.com', 'username': 'mnikolaenko'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-05 23:47:42.000000000', 'files': ['httpd/keystone-uwsgi-admin.ini', 'httpd/keystone-uwsgi-public.ini', 'doc/source/apache-httpd.rst'], 'message': 'Keystone uwsgi performance tuning

I ran some tests locally that showed that when using the uwsgi
deploy the keystone server wasn't using all the processes
available. When I switched from "threads" to "processes" the
concurrent performance improved considerably. So I'm proposing
that the docs use processes to improve performance.

Change-Id: I5375702f45ccb82c02ff2bba1eabda836d5d25eb
'}]
commit_message:
Keystone uwsgi performance tuning

I ran some tests locally that showed that when using the uwsgi
deploy the keystone server wasn't using all the processes
available. When I switched from "threads" to "processes" the
concurrent performance improved considerably. So I'm proposing
that the docs use processes to improve performance.

Change-Id: I5375702f45ccb82c02ff2bba1eabda836d5d25eb

commit_message:
Make error message in modal a unified style

When the required field in a modal form leaved blank, all the error
message are in red only the asterisk is in blue. All the error
message should be in unified style.

Change-Id: I7aaffdb79f72173f39f53329ea5595f61f6ffecc
Closes-Bug: #1588136

commit_message:
Convergence: Fix unit tests

Some of the unit tests fail when convergence_engine is set as true
in config. This is mainly due to the convergence flag in some of the
functions/methods which is expected to be True but is set to False for
legacy engine.

Change-Id: I57ef37d4fd79f0b453aef9c16876495901c2d802
Closes-Bug: #1567321

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-05-26 09:44:03.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_create_server.py', 'tempest/tests/common/test_waiters.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_server_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/common/waiters.py', 'tempest/common/baremetal.py', 'tempest/common/compute.py'], 'message': "Update tests to work with Ironic grenade

Smoke tests that can't work with Ironic due to design are skipped
when Ironic is enabled.
In case of Ironic after instace delete cleaning process is called.
We consider instance is deleted when:
 * Instance is disassociated from Ironic node.
 * Node is moved to available state.
 * Nova hypervisor fields are updated.
Add additional check wait_bm_node_unprovisioned after instance deleting
to wait for Ironic node to be in available state and hypervisor stats
are updated.

Change-Id: I15d23b474e4654d1ef513e6409399f44f088b5c5
Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok (vdrok@mirantis.com)
"}]
commit_message:
Update tests to work with Ironic grenade

Smoke tests that can't work with Ironic due to design are skipped
when Ironic is enabled.
In case of Ironic after instace delete cleaning process is called.
We consider instance is deleted when:
 * Instance is disassociated from Ironic node.
 * Node is moved to available state.
 * Nova hypervisor fields are updated.
Add additional check wait_bm_node_unprovisioned after instance deleting
to wait for Ironic node to be in available state and hypervisor stats
are updated.

Change-Id: I15d23b474e4654d1ef513e6409399f44f088b5c5
Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok (vdrok@mirantis.com)

The plugin was broken by tempest
change I5a4523c20c19957bfccf2aa95157baf106b3d364. We can't blame tempest
here because we definitely referred to an internal symbol in tempest
tree.

Now we have a proper symbol from tempest.lib, so it should be safe to

commit_message:
Fixed tempest plugin

The plugin was broken by tempest
change I5a4523c20c19957bfccf2aa95157baf106b3d364. We can't blame tempest
here because we definitely referred to an internal symbol in tempest
tree.

Now we have a proper symbol from tempest.lib, so it should be safe to
use it.

(cherry picked from commit 73474780aa3ba094e8fe01ae33269b7ad43dc2b0)
Change-Id: I42812a949103679e2559f310bb95c597c368015f
Closes-Bug: #1589521

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-25 22:33:25.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Allow to set Ironic provision timeout from the job

Launching smoke tempest tests building several instances in parallel.
As result grenade job that uses tempest smoke tests need to have
higher provision/unprovision timeout values value.
This patch allows to set BUILD_TIMEOUT from the job.

Change-Id: Idd454b7dea2a6d37a6bc048132fc2b3765d37429
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to set Ironic provision timeout from the job

Launching smoke tempest tests building several instances in parallel.
As result grenade job that uses tempest smoke tests need to have
higher provision/unprovision timeout values value.
This patch allows to set BUILD_TIMEOUT from the job.

Change-Id: Idd454b7dea2a6d37a6bc048132fc2b3765d37429

Optimize service find in migration

Run only once will be better of volume_utils.extract_host(host, 'backend'),
It's a waste time in every iteration.

Change-Id: I161de42b8ea421766f1fd980ac64334ca9f1c5fd

commit_message:
Make the notifier max_workers configurable

Make the max_workers attribute of NotifierDriver configurable.
Now it can be configured using 'max_workers' parameter. Default
value of max_workers is 10.

Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan<wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
Change-Id: Ice7d12199f8463793951932b48408e7df81440f2

subject: Show 'age' field in subscriptions (redis)
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-06 22:40:56.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/storage/redis/utils.py', 'zaqar/storage/redis/models.py', 'zaqar/storage/redis/subscriptions.py'], 'message': "Show 'age' field in subscriptions (redis)

We recently fixed subscriptions and now they are expirable resources as
they should be.

This patch adds 'age' field to subscription resource representation
which is exposed to the user and defined in redis driver.

This patch also removes existing 'expires' field, because:
1. The 'expires' field is missing in mongodb's subscription resource
representation. (But age field was also missing until a recent patch).
2. The 'expires' field has int (timestamp) format, which is not human
readable.
3. Other Zaqar's expirable resources show 'age' and 'ttl' fields instead
of showing 'expires' field.
4. There is no need in 'expires' field when 'age' and 'ttl' fields are
exposed to the user.

This change in unlikely to affect backward compatibility, because
subscription expirations started to work only recently.

Closes-Bug: 1552845
APIImpact
DocImpact
Change-Id: I18f908b2f137bd4b8e5b3d3275063a1d37942093
"}]
commit_message:
Show 'age' field in subscriptions (redis)

We recently fixed subscriptions and now they are expirable resources as
they should be.

This patch adds 'age' field to subscription resource representation
which is exposed to the user and defined in redis driver.

This patch also removes existing 'expires' field, because:
1. The 'expires' field is missing in mongodb's subscription resource
representation. (But age field was also missing until a recent patch).
2. The 'expires' field has int (timestamp) format, which is not human
readable.
3. Other Zaqar's expirable resources show 'age' and 'ttl' fields instead
of showing 'expires' field.
4. There is no need in 'expires' field when 'age' and 'ttl' fields are
exposed to the user.

This change in unlikely to affect backward compatibility, because
subscription expirations started to work only recently.

Closes-Bug: 1552845
APIImpact
DocImpact
Change-Id: I18f908b2f137bd4b8e5b3d3275063a1d37942093

commit_message:
Show 'age' field in subscriptions (mongodb)

We recently fixed subscriptions and now they are expirable resources as
they should be.
But now, unlike messages and claims, they don't show their age, so it's
impossible for the user to know when the particular subscription will
expire.

This patch adds 'age' field to subscription resource representation
returned from mongodb driver. Tests are modified to make them check also
'age' field.

Partial-Bug: 1552845
APIImpact
DocImpact
Change-Id: I5eb6a6a267161ec7ee6a7cda094dd55960520069

commit_message:
Cleanup source-repositories output

This element takes up a *huge* part of the logs of openstack-infra
builds as we go and cache every git tree.

This silences most of the noise which will reduce the mess
in the logs considerably.

Note that we've had logging on this turned down since
I91c5e55814ba9840769357261d203f4850e2eba6 but it has been
ineffective in stopping the log-spew output, see the
dependency change.

Change-Id: I60f06f84d57087c82b3907575bff125015d35171
Depends-On: I1e39822f218dc0322e2490a770f3dc867a55802c

commit_message:
Create default mtu and default routes for switch and subnet

Make sure that if an mtu is not specified on an lswitch, then its value
is None, and make sure that if no host_routes were defined on a subnet,
then the value is the empty list.

Closes-Bug: 1589387

commit_message:
Add cloud-initramfs-growroot for Precise

Add a pkg-map to install cloud-initramfs-growroot on Precise, as it is
required there because the kernel is too old to use growroot on a live
file-system.  This was generically removed in
e23b087505b85ae1da11054aa980a956f2ec7195.

Change-Id: I5e6cbc4b74dc72a6f23f73a018c028f3ff7c0157

subject: Add PS4 to show file/function/line in debug output
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-17 23:50:57.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create'], 'message': 'Add PS4 to show file/function/line in debug output

For something fairly simple, I went back-and-forward with this a bit.

Firstly, I realise calling readlink constantly sucks.  Due to the way
we call dib and source various files, you end up with the source-file
from "caller" being usually a very ugly path including levels of "../"
indirection.  Cleaning this up to something canonical is the only sane
way to present it.

Because we evaluate _ps4() from a sub-shell in the PS4 string, there's
no way for it to do something like build a global in-memory cache in
an associative array or similar.  It could write out a temp file or
some other side-band method, but the overheads of managing this don't
seem any different to just calling readlink.  If anyone can think of a
bash-hack around this that doesn't involve a fork() I'm interested.

We could potentially strip some of the leading paths in the assumption
you know what they are; but it gets complex when things are split
across /usr/bin & /usr/lib and external elements, etc.  I thought
about arbitrarily shortening it (e.g. just take last 20 characters)
which gives you enough of an idea of the file, but looks a bit ugly.
Or we could just leave the file-name out all together and assume the
function name is unique enough; this also seemed a bit ugly.

Obviously it's a matter of taste in the output.  It is certainly
wider, but it also adds a lot of information.  It also makes it fairly
clear where there are things we can make less verbose,
e.g. I1e39822f218dc0322e2490a770f3dc867a55802c disables tracing in
run-parts which is just noise.  There's a few other frequently used
loops that we could disable tracing for by default to benefit
signal:noise.

tl;dr : take a look at the logs.  I think it is a step in the right
direction of making the logs more usable for debugging.

Change-Id: I8054a3050415fcb527baeb7012bf133e5c864bf3
'}]
commit_message:
Add PS4 to show file/function/line in debug output

For something fairly simple, I went back-and-forward with this a bit.

Firstly, I realise calling readlink constantly sucks.  Due to the way
we call dib and source various files, you end up with the source-file
from "caller" being usually a very ugly path including levels of "../"
indirection.  Cleaning this up to something canonical is the only sane
way to present it.

Because we evaluate _ps4() from a sub-shell in the PS4 string, there's
no way for it to do something like build a global in-memory cache in
an associative array or similar.  It could write out a temp file or
some other side-band method, but the overheads of managing this don't
seem any different to just calling readlink.  If anyone can think of a
bash-hack around this that doesn't involve a fork() I'm interested.

We could potentially strip some of the leading paths in the assumption
you know what they are; but it gets complex when things are split
across /usr/bin & /usr/lib and external elements, etc.  I thought
about arbitrarily shortening it (e.g. just take last 20 characters)
which gives you enough of an idea of the file, but looks a bit ugly.
Or we could just leave the file-name out all together and assume the
function name is unique enough; this also seemed a bit ugly.

Obviously it's a matter of taste in the output.  It is certainly
wider, but it also adds a lot of information.  It also makes it fairly
clear where there are things we can make less verbose,
e.g. I1e39822f218dc0322e2490a770f3dc867a55802c disables tracing in
run-parts which is just noise.  There's a few other frequently used
loops that we could disable tracing for by default to benefit
signal:noise.

tl;dr : take a look at the logs.  I think it is a step in the right
direction of making the logs more usable for debugging.

Change-Id: I8054a3050415fcb527baeb7012bf133e5c864bf3

subject: Refactor: remove unused functions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 20:08:16.000000000', 'files': ['lib/img-functions', 'lib/common-functions'], 'message': "Refactor: remove unused functions

There were a couple of functions which were unused:
ensure_nbd, map_nbd, unmount_qcow_image, mount_qcow_image, ensure_sudo
Because some of them use 'trap ... EXIT' this hinders introducing a
separate exit phase - therefore they are removed.

(It would also be impossible to use them in the current setup, because
they overwrite the 'trap ... EXIT' of the disk-image-creates 'main'.)

Change-Id: If932a557dca9aea4864154ad6c4f286373d6dd7c
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor: remove unused functions

There were a couple of functions which were unused:
ensure_nbd, map_nbd, unmount_qcow_image, mount_qcow_image, ensure_sudo
Because some of them use 'trap ... EXIT' this hinders introducing a
separate exit phase - therefore they are removed.

(It would also be impossible to use them in the current setup, because
they overwrite the 'trap ... EXIT' of the disk-image-creates 'main'.)

Change-Id: If932a557dca9aea4864154ad6c4f286373d6dd7c
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Add release to pkg-map

Add ability to filter in pkg-map on release, which defaults to
DIB_RELEASE.  As per the examples, release is a more specific target
than distro, but distro still has to match.

Added a debug flag and ability to use a pkg-map directly for
debugging/development.

Change-Id: Ie282f96966e46236b06bc276de0168fc7a66c5da

commit_message:
Export die() function

I realised I'd been using die() in a few places assuming it was
available, but it wasn't exported.  I guess it didn't matter because
whatever was wrong, we were failing anyway :)

This exports the function to make it available to sub-processes, which
should remove the need to source it as done in several places.

Change-Id: I7b9a5a6db406e160099b6ed9fde80455ae227327

commit_message:
Refactor: rename temporary directories

The temporary directories for image creation and building the OS both
started with 'image' as their names followed by some random
characters.  During debugging this is annoying, because on first sight
it is not clear, where which files are stored.

This patch renames them to dib_build.XXXXXXXX and dib_image.XXXXXXXX.

This patch introduces no user-visible change:
the temporary directories are only used during the
run of disk-image-builder.

Change-Id: I249cdb7750fe9a746b375b462789cd9b82681a2e
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
tox respects upper-constraints.txt

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

There are a few 'post' jobs as Andreas has mentioned on this review,
that have the install_command overridden (until that will be supported
in upstream infra).

This change has been inspired by
Ie1133e4c020106e8098685ba9125f84b356d8e0c , notes from jaegerandi in the
openstack/glance's tox.ini file and Ihar's python-neutronclient's fix
I33302cdcab980a42c39dc9ec1e430add459615ff

Change-Id: I1f8be8184683c9a3671f750ebaa87c38163c9795
Closes-Bug: 1563038

commit_message:
Make sure audit can handle API requests which does not require a token

Some service APIs such as Swift list public containers does not require
a token. Therefore, there will be no identity or service catalog information
available. In these cases, audit should fill in the default
(i.e. taxonomy.UNKNOWN) for both initiator and target instead of raising an
exception.

Change-Id: I3f3c12d5e8c0fa176fb7f0218c368971e0a9d0b5
Closes-Bug: 1583699

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-25 00:33:18.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1583690-da67472d7afff0bf.yaml', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/test_audit_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/audit.py'], 'message': 'Determine project name from oslo_config or local config

For services such as Swift, which may not be utilizing oslo_config, we need
to be able to determine the project name from local config. If project name
is specified in both local config and oslo_config, the one in local config will
be used instead.

In case project is undetermined (i.e. not set), we use taxonomy.UNKNOWN
as an indicator so operators can take corrective actions.

Change-Id: Ia95cbc9974d0c39c6b77d966cffdef2885350d77
Closes-Bug: 1583690
'}]
commit_message:
Determine project name from oslo_config or local config

For services such as Swift, which may not be utilizing oslo_config, we need
to be able to determine the project name from local config. If project name
is specified in both local config and oslo_config, the one in local config will
be used instead.

In case project is undetermined (i.e. not set), we use taxonomy.UNKNOWN
as an indicator so operators can take corrective actions.

Change-Id: Ia95cbc9974d0c39c6b77d966cffdef2885350d77
Closes-Bug: 1583690

commit_message:
Add Try/Exception to Extension Supported call in Ports

The port form makes 2 Neutron api calls ('is_extension_supported')
without proper exception handling.

Placed each call within try/except block. For admin and project
dashboards.

Potential solution posed by itxakaserrano is to make the actual
Neutron api call try/catch with logging and return the
Exception if raised.

Change-Id: I357175e4be43b09dfa74ffe8a1d2c8c7ea49ce93
Closes-Bug: #1434116

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-29 17:45:10.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': 'Install and run StackViz during devstack-gate host cleanup

StackViz is a utility for visualizing the performance of DevStack and
Tempest executions. This adds a new function, `process_stackviz`, that
copies a static site template built during nodepool image build (see
dependent patch), and then installs and runs a small Python module
(already cached on the filesystem) to process subunit data. This data,
along with the static template, is then copied into the log output
directory so that it can be uploaded to the log server when the job
finishes.

Change-Id: Ia5bee69f2874ca50ac6148494d2926ef4ab73b6b

commit_message:
Install and run StackViz during devstack-gate host cleanup

StackViz is a utility for visualizing the performance of DevStack and
Tempest executions. This adds a new function, `process_stackviz`, that
copies a static site template built during nodepool image build (see
dependent patch), and then installs and runs a small Python module
(already cached on the filesystem) to process subunit data. This data,
along with the static template, is then copied into the log output
directory so that it can be uploaded to the log server when the job
finishes.

Change-Id: Ia5bee69f2874ca50ac6148494d2926ef4ab73b6b
Depends-On: I9bc50b8eba696264d2b97ed20a37f28f4768abb8

commit_message:
Fix release note links to (now) external docs

Moving the old release notes into the Reno releasenots tree broke
the embedded :doc: roles.  Restore these using sphinx.ext.extlinks to
manage the URL to the OSC docs.

Add the following aliases:
* lpbug - generic Launchpad bug        :lpbug:`123456`
* oscbp - OSC blueprints               :oscbp:`Blue Print <bp-name>`
* oscdoc - OSC Docs                    :oscdoc:`Comamnd List <command-list>`

Change-Id: Iecfdd666d961c35f0ccb3b9f10df1d2620cb099f

subject: Ensure nova-network service is up before creating networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-03 07:55:35.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/network.pp'], 'message': 'Ensure nova-network service is up before creating networks

https://review.openstack.org/229895 made sure nova networks could
only be created if the nova-network service was enabled. However,
it is still possible that Puppet tries to create them before the
service is started.

This patch should be backported to stable/mitaka and stable/liberty.

Change-Id: Iaf21b70f274d2c5769c6bb117697efe9e74873fd
(cherry picked from commit cd3611beb9801f2b91a63251810f1468d5d7e9a0)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure nova-network service is up before creating networks

https://review.openstack.org/229895 made sure nova networks could
only be created if the nova-network service was enabled. However,
it is still possible that Puppet tries to create them before the
service is started.

This patch should be backported to stable/mitaka and stable/liberty.

Change-Id: Iaf21b70f274d2c5769c6bb117697efe9e74873fd
(cherry picked from commit cd3611beb9801f2b91a63251810f1468d5d7e9a0)

commit_message:
[GATE UNBLOCKER] Lock CPU map script to a release

The CPU map script from devstack has been removed upstream.
This needs to be locked down to ensure we're not using the head
of master when depending on this script.

Upstream commit where the script was removed: [0].

To stablize the gate the script has been locked down using the a
SHA from the "stable/liberty" branch within upstream "devstack/tools" [1].

[0] - https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/214459cdf776a77dacd70a9205c5b8a6ceaff31a
[1] - http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/plain/tools/cpu_map_update.py?h=d5b4ac741c28930c6749497af8e8a38ccb59893c

Change-Id: I0d55e799e4b4caff502438747fc65729dcaefd7e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 08ae3501d84d720a48c6c5a7fc0affa04b751d2e)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 18:11:52.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-jobs-gerrit.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Allow user to run tox -ecireport

Here we are fixing 2 bugs:
 - Add missing SSH port for review.o.o
 - Allow tox to read SSH_AUTH_SOCK, so we don't prompt for SSH private
   key more then once.

Change-Id: Ia3f1205b5169df7af67926810bd298cd25716b26
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Allow user to run tox -ecireport

Here we are fixing 2 bugs:
 - Add missing SSH port for review.o.o
 - Allow tox to read SSH_AUTH_SOCK, so we don't prompt for SSH private
   key more then once.

Change-Id: Ia3f1205b5169df7af67926810bd298cd25716b26
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Allow an operator to run an action on all services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 00:03:55.000000000', 'files': ['kolla_kubernetes/service_definition.py', 'kolla_kubernetes/service.py', 'kolla_kubernetes/cli/service.py'], 'message': "Allow an operator to run an action on all services

In addition to specifying a service name with an action,
the operator can use 'all'.

For example, to run all bootstrapping jobs the operator would
run:

     kolla-kubernetes bootstrap all

Change-Id: I4fc796a1e420924527b5f69cef87ea2597edd8c7
Partially-implements: blueprint kolla-kubernetes-cli
"}]
commit_message:
Allow an operator to run an action on all services

In addition to specifying a service name with an action,
the operator can use 'all'.

For example, to run all bootstrapping jobs the operator would
run:

     kolla-kubernetes bootstrap all

Change-Id: I4fc796a1e420924527b5f69cef87ea2597edd8c7
Partially-implements: blueprint kolla-kubernetes-cli

subject: Set correct tox dir for all-plugin environment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 12:39:51.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Set correct tox dir for all-plugin environment

Devstack installs plugins with the 'venv-tempest' environment, which
uses the .tox/tempest/ directory. all-plugin is missing the envdir
configuration that should cause it to use this directory as well. Set
this such that using all-plugin environment runs what we expect.

Change-Id: Icff53f8c57d0176e7ad6616c0f705d9c8f4d7af3
"}]
commit_message:
Set correct tox dir for all-plugin environment

Devstack installs plugins with the 'venv-tempest' environment, which
uses the .tox/tempest/ directory. all-plugin is missing the envdir
configuration that should cause it to use this directory as well. Set
this such that using all-plugin environment runs what we expect.

Change-Id: Icff53f8c57d0176e7ad6616c0f705d9c8f4d7af3

subject: Make registering error handlers compliant with Flask 0.11
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 09:08:09.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/server.py'], 'message': 'Make registering error handlers compliant with Flask 0.11

With Flask 0.11 setting error handlers by directly modifying
app.error_handler_spec dictionary leads to AttributeErrors.
It should be done by using register_error_handler method or
errorhandler decorator.

Change-Id: I2f41ab2b9ea8c4a964b16acdf77def1b08b64a6e
Closes-Bug: #1587849
(cherry picked from commit 685f7c17fd5c882e1b7198507112c2ebb8fce745)
'}]
commit_message:
Make registering error handlers compliant with Flask 0.11

With Flask 0.11 setting error handlers by directly modifying
app.error_handler_spec dictionary leads to AttributeErrors.
It should be done by using register_error_handler method or
errorhandler decorator.

Change-Id: I2f41ab2b9ea8c4a964b16acdf77def1b08b64a6e
Closes-Bug: #1587849
(cherry picked from commit 685f7c17fd5c882e1b7198507112c2ebb8fce745)

subject: Refactor SetService --enable/disable option
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-04 14:46:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_service.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/service.py', 'doc/source/command-objects/compute-service.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/service-set-option-61772a8940ad0778.yaml'], 'message': 'Refactor SetService --enable/disable option

This patch changes the following:

1. --enable/disable option should follow the rules
   in the doc below:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/command-options.html#boolean-options

2. "--disable-resion" is specified but not "--disable",
   an exception is raised instead of igoring
   "--disable-reason" option.

Change-Id: I92e9234111e661bfe7119a8e19389a87c874ab0c
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor SetService --enable/disable option

This patch changes the following:

1. --enable/disable option should follow the rules
   in the doc below:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/command-options.html#boolean-options

2. "--disable-resion" is specified but not "--disable",
   an exception is raised instead of igoring
   "--disable-reason" option.

Change-Id: I92e9234111e661bfe7119a8e19389a87c874ab0c

commit_message:
Make set/unset commands in volume return normally when nothing specified

set/unset commands should ends up normally instead of
logging an error when nothing is specified to modify.
The main reason is: When nothing is specified, the
command sets/unsets nothing, which is a normal behavior,
and ends up normally. No API call fails. No error happens.

Change-Id: Ib03a512650e5da90aa1ef38019772448383d0d33
Partial-bug: #1588588

commit_message:
fullstack: Use noop firewall

Currently fullstack tests don't use hybrid plugging but they use hybrid
firewall by default. Using iptables is not segregated and OVS agents
running in parallel may interfere between each other.

This patch removes using iptables in ovs agents per created port.

Change-Id: Ic15c942360a4a6ecf0eb5d8ecbbc54e59b10431d
Closes-Bug: #1575033
(cherry picked from commit 77456735cbc9066dda8186937cb6ee2073833123)

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-26 08:49:55.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Return BadRequest for invalid 4byte unicode character

If the database fails to insert values containing
4byte unicode character that the database can't support
(or other similar errors that fall under DBDataError),
return an HTTP 400 Bad Request rather than HTTP 500.

This patch fixes:

1. volume image-metadata
2. volume metadata
3. volume metadata-update-all
4. snapshot-metadata
5. snapshot-metadata-update-all
6. volume transfer-create

APIImpact: For all of the above APIs, it will return 400 error instead
of 500 if user passes 4 byte unicode character in the request.

Closes-Bug: #1583528
Change-Id: I50d873d4de226cb12ca4f8c4ce38dca3d2fab494
"}]
commit_message:
Return BadRequest for invalid 4byte unicode character

If the database fails to insert values containing
4byte unicode character that the database can't support
(or other similar errors that fall under DBDataError),
return an HTTP 400 Bad Request rather than HTTP 500.

This patch fixes:

1. volume image-metadata
2. volume metadata
3. volume metadata-update-all
4. snapshot-metadata
5. snapshot-metadata-update-all
6. volume transfer-create

APIImpact: For all of the above APIs, it will return 400 error instead
of 500 if user passes 4 byte unicode character in the request.

Closes-Bug: #1583528
Change-Id: I50d873d4de226cb12ca4f8c4ce38dca3d2fab494

commit_message:
[WIP] rework quickstart.sh to enable upstream, downstream and other playbooks

* move most things out of the playbooks directory so only playbooks exist there
* create a config directory w/ config/release and config/general_config so roles
can insert configuration more easily
* add options to support different playbooks, requirements.
* move the image_url into a config/release file
* move the working_dir to tripleo-quickstart/.quickstart so by default users can
clone and have multiple independent installations w/o changing flags.
* move the clone of quickstart out of a function and into a global space to
preserve the OPT_WORKDIR variable.
* add additional help and information on flags
* if localhost is specified as $VIRTHOST, reset the var to 127.0.0.2
* add message re: how to login for any tag

Change-Id: Ia1c90ec56b774134ad1675972e3b94e76e98bb3f

If a user chooses `localhost` as the VIRTHOST there are now two

commit_message:
localhost is a reserved term by ansible, use 127.0.0.2 instead

If a user chooses `localhost` as the VIRTHOST there are now two
endpoints with the same name. It's more clear to catch the setting
and set localhost to 127.0.0.2 to avoid conflicts and confusion.
Additionally there are no changes required to tags etc.

Change-Id: I749d3f330491916694c5fe9cdd579b7b8a681538

it is returning different value.
To fix this, we check if a value for key already exists in

commit_message:
item allocator should return same value for same key

When ItemAllocator.allocate called with same key again,
it is returning different value.
To fix this, we check if a value for key already exists in
self.allocations, and return that value if already exists.

Closes-bug: #1533216
Change-Id: I1f6191b07d33a1f542de18a942cefaf7ecb6c143

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-06 21:02:41.000000000', 'files': ['other-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add libffi-dev libssl-dev as binary dependencies

Due to the problem with the new version of cryptography==1.4 we need to
add libffi-dev and libssl-dev in a list of binary dependency to properly
prepare CI environments and unblock gates.

Change-Id: I521776d156f8d69f060185d089adb817139300d6
'}]
commit_message:
Add libffi-dev libssl-dev as binary dependencies

Due to the problem with the new version of cryptography==1.4 we need to
add libffi-dev and libssl-dev in a list of binary dependency to properly
prepare CI environments and unblock gates.

Change-Id: I521776d156f8d69f060185d089adb817139300d6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 18:20:16.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova', 'doc/source/guides/devstack-with-lbaas-v2.rst'], 'message': 'Remove nova-cert deployment

nova-cert was a server daemon that serves the Nova Cert service for X509
certificates, when used to generate certificates for euca-bundle-image and only
needed for EC2 API [1].

This patch aims to remove nova-cert from default deployments, which is
now useless.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/man/nova-cert.html#description

Change-Id: I92dd0a742b48cc55ac5b02f780066db7eb903226
'}]
commit_message:
Remove nova-cert deployment

nova-cert was a server daemon that serves the Nova Cert service for X509
certificates, when used to generate certificates for euca-bundle-image and only
needed for EC2 API [1].

This patch aims to remove nova-cert from default deployments, which is
now useless.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/man/nova-cert.html#description

Change-Id: I92dd0a742b48cc55ac5b02f780066db7eb903226

commit_message:
Add a required_api_version validator

New validator required_api_version is introduced to validating
the api version needed to run the scenario.

This patch also adds the validator to the keystone v2 specific
scenarios.

Change-Id: I1cd97d88545fa3a363009e36515f5ae1cb5bc3a9
Closes-bug: #1442633

commit_message:
Simplify translation sync

Since we do not store any pot files in git anymore, the optimization to
only push to the translation server if strings have changed, is not
possible anymore. Remove this code now, this includes removing
some git adds for pot files.

Change-Id: I28ad9edc49b0f840cd51354334d7ae08aadab87a

subject: move ironic.conf modifcation to an undercloud role
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-06 19:01:59.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo/undercloud/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "move ironic.conf modifcation to an undercloud role

When running with virthost == localhost the ssh.config.ansible
is not valid as it's trying to proxy through the localhost.
This is fixed in the ansible-role-tripleo-inventory role.
Changing the ironic.conf file on the undercloud must come
after there is a valid ssh config file in all scenarios.
It's safe to move this to the first step in the tripleo/undercloud
role.

Change-Id: I6a5d692a1b1783130fcd3aec2fba9be453fc8e3b
"}]
commit_message:
move ironic.conf modifcation to an undercloud role

When running with virthost == localhost the ssh.config.ansible
is not valid as it's trying to proxy through the localhost.
This is fixed in the ansible-role-tripleo-inventory role.
Changing the ironic.conf file on the undercloud must come
after there is a valid ssh config file in all scenarios.
It's safe to move this to the first step in the tripleo/undercloud
role.

Change-Id: I6a5d692a1b1783130fcd3aec2fba9be453fc8e3b

subject: Add rabbit_ha_queues option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-05 16:14:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/conductor.pp', 'manifests/api.pp', 'manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/taskmanager.pp', 'spec/classes/trove_api_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/trove_conductor_spec.rb', 'manifests/guestagent.pp', 'spec/classes/trove_guestagent_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/trove_taskmanager_spec.rb'], 'message': "Add rabbit_ha_queues option

There are two methods for setting up RabbitMQ HA:

 1. Configure rabbit_hosts to multi rabbit hosts.
 2. Setting up a loadbalancer in front of RabbitMQ cluster,
    provide a unique address in rabbit_host

In current, rabbit_ha_queues option is controled by rabbit_hosts IF
conditional statement. But when users want to use the second method:
changing rabbit_ha_queues to true, but they don't use rabbit_hosts
option, this logic will not work.

This patch adds an rabbit_ha_queues option, set it to undef by
default for forward compatbility.

Close-Bug: #1485287
Change-Id: Ib8fe16182188729100ef4704466c4d42d31ff510
(cherry picked from commit 2443294da20b9f59ce5001b957a4bffe0798b340)
"}]
commit_message:
Add rabbit_ha_queues option

There are two methods for setting up RabbitMQ HA:

 1. Configure rabbit_hosts to multi rabbit hosts.
 2. Setting up a loadbalancer in front of RabbitMQ cluster,
    provide a unique address in rabbit_host

In current, rabbit_ha_queues option is controled by rabbit_hosts IF
conditional statement. But when users want to use the second method:
changing rabbit_ha_queues to true, but they don't use rabbit_hosts
option, this logic will not work.

This patch adds an rabbit_ha_queues option, set it to undef by
default for forward compatbility.

Close-Bug: #1485287
Change-Id: Ib8fe16182188729100ef4704466c4d42d31ff510
(cherry picked from commit 2443294da20b9f59ce5001b957a4bffe0798b340)

commit_message:
Ensure nova-network service is up before creating networks

https://review.openstack.org/229895 made sure nova networks could
only be created if the nova-network service was enabled. However,
it is still possible that Puppet tries to create them before the
service is started.

This patch should be backported to stable/mitaka and stable/liberty.

Change-Id: Iaf21b70f274d2c5769c6bb117697efe9e74873fd
(cherry picked from commit cd3611beb9801f2b91a63251810f1468d5d7e9a0)

Confirm and correct list methods and response codes in os-cells.

This is mostly just checking, correcting and adding methods, but
in the process of doing that it became clear that there was quite
a bit missing so several TODO notes have been left in place so that
the next stages of work are a bit more obvious.

* 405 has been removed everywhere as we don't send that response

  tenant_id does not match the context's project_id

  in this api

commit_message:
api-ref method verification for os-cells

Confirm and correct list methods and response codes in os-cells.

This is mostly just checking, correcting and adding methods, but
in the process of doing that it became clear that there was quite
a bit missing so several TODO notes have been left in place so that
the next stages of work are a bit more obvious.

* 405 has been removed everywhere as we don't send that response
* 400 badRequest is required anywhere, as that's what you'll get if
  tenant_id does not match the context's project_id
* 503 does not happen as there's no application controlled proxying
  in this api
* the URL for listing cells with details was incorrect
* the example response for cells with details was an empty list,
  this is now a todo suggesting an as yet non-existent file
* capacities was not listed, now is
* not clear what capacities really are, so a TODO
* creating a new cell (via POST) was not there, so that is now added
  as a method
* for that POST, request and response bodies, parameters currently a
  TODO
* Update (PUT) and DELETE of a cell has been added, but details are TODO

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I3f123f821820e5a5a4deff61fb716d43dc486142

commit_message:
Reduce time to delete instance when in ERROR state

In an attempt to decrease the time it takes to delete an instance when in ERROR
state, add condition to check if the instance is in ACTIVE/SHUTDOWN state before
attempting to stop the database.

Change-Id: Id6f7c56a8205ccc6b2eece782ebfc6340086714d

commit_message:
Remove redundant orphan instances unit test

There was a test class in test_resource_tracker.py that was testing the
RT's _find_orphaned_instances() method. The test_tracker.py's
test_orphaned_instances_no_migrations() unit test covers this code path
more extensively so we delete it from test_resource_tracker.py.

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints.txt file for all tox targets

The only targets that are left unconstrained are those that belong to
post merge queues where constraints are not yet available.

For Liberty, use stable/liberty version of the constraints file.

Change-Id: I0546be87a0bb2a34b8c030d883ede3c45e6d6f54
(cherry picked from commit acbf4f9a1d7cf11cca812c0c48ca080ffe0589c4)

commit_message:
Added provision state manipulation

Provision states may now be updated via a handy modal window. This
modal window is intended to provide basic functionality. Refining
the UX and handling errors in a more graceful fashion will be added
in subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I778949b5bdea2b52035e071bf5985cf318c3517a

commit_message:
Reduce time to delete instance when in ERROR state

In an attempt to decrease the time it takes to delete an instance when in ERROR
state, add condition to check if the instance is in ACTIVE/SHUTDOWN state before
attempting to stop the database.

Change-Id: Id6f7c56a8205ccc6b2eece782ebfc6340086714d

commit_message:
Explicitly tell karma to use different ports.

It appears that the second test suite occasionally blocks after
the first test suite, which could be caused by a blocked port.
This patch attempts to remedy this situation.
