subject: Ensure test volume file permissions are correct
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 13:44:50.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/cinder_setup_test_volume_spec.rb', 'manifests/setup_test_volume.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/Test-volume-permissions-7ca9964fdb8491a2.yaml'], 'message': 'Ensure test volume file permissions are correct

When setting up a test volume, we use dd (usually as root) to create
the file used for a loop mount. Permissions on that file will depend
on the umask, but they should not grant read for all to prevent
information leaks from Cinder volumes to any user.

Change-Id: Ie84650ec13cf746a3bbc99c9f652832c655f182f
(cherry picked from commit a8b991f6bebf770efe34c67d8bbea7b092db0000)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure test volume file permissions are correct

When setting up a test volume, we use dd (usually as root) to create
the file used for a loop mount. Permissions on that file will depend
on the umask, but they should not grant read for all to prevent
information leaks from Cinder volumes to any user.

Change-Id: Ie84650ec13cf746a3bbc99c9f652832c655f182f
(cherry picked from commit a8b991f6bebf770efe34c67d8bbea7b092db0000)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-06 17:28:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_client.py', 'nova/objects/service.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Revert cell DB inventory/allocations migrations

The inventory and allocations tables are moved to the API database (and
eventually will move to the placement DB). The online data migration
work done for moving the inventory fields from compute_nodes into
inventories is not going to be done via the object model. Instead, we
have agreed to have the nova-compute's resource tracker call the new
resource-providers REST API (the placement API introduced in the
generic-resource-pools spec) and populate the resource-providers schema
that way.

This reverts all the complicated database joins that were introduced
when we thought that inventories and allocations tables would exist in
the cell DB and in the process "fixes" LP bug 1572555 by reverting the
compute_node_statistics() method to not look at the inventories or
allocations tables.

Change-Id: I90fe4443f393e9c95839442400edcd60c5d19a7d
Closes-bug: #1572555
'}]
commit_message:
Revert cell DB inventory/allocations migrations

The inventory and allocations tables are moved to the API database (and
eventually will move to the placement DB). The online data migration
work done for moving the inventory fields from compute_nodes into
inventories is not going to be done via the object model. Instead, we
have agreed to have the nova-compute's resource tracker call the new
resource-providers REST API (the placement API introduced in the
generic-resource-pools spec) and populate the resource-providers schema
that way.

This reverts all the complicated database joins that were introduced
when we thought that inventories and allocations tables would exist in
the cell DB and in the process "fixes" LP bug 1572555 by reverting the
compute_node_statistics() method to not look at the inventories or
allocations tables.

Change-Id: I90fe4443f393e9c95839442400edcd60c5d19a7d
Closes-bug: #1572555

difference in there stats.

subject: Get translation jobs into healthcheck
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-03 15:37:20.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/translation-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/upstream_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Get translation jobs into healthcheck

Add subunit testr output at end of run of the translation scripts, so
that healthcheck will have information about success/failure of the job.

This is implemented as an exit trap since we abort on every error and
need to provide the failure message.

Also, upload the healthcheck data to logs.openstack.org so that
healthcheck can import it.

This should be a temporary solution until healthcheck can get data from
Zuul about failure/success of job runs using database access.

Change-Id: I74bba9659a9767027e2daa649ec6f38bf822b65a
'}]
commit_message:
Get translation jobs into healthcheck

Add subunit testr output at end of run of the translation scripts, so
that healthcheck will have information about success/failure of the job.

This is implemented as an exit trap since we abort on every error and
need to provide the failure message.

Also, upload the healthcheck data to logs.openstack.org so that
healthcheck can import it.

This should be a temporary solution until healthcheck can get data from
Zuul about failure/success of job runs using database access.

Change-Id: I74bba9659a9767027e2daa649ec6f38bf822b65a

subject: Do not rely on neutron agent enablement to create $OVS_BRIDGE
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-06 18:01:42.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base'], 'message': "Do not rely on neutron agent enablement to create $OVS_BRIDGE

Control nodes where n-cpu and q-agt aren't running,
but q-l3 is running, still require $OVS_BRIDGE to be present.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-June/096693.html

Change-Id: I8d30e4b8bf9caadca15c4497aed3711af33d371d
"}]
commit_message:
Do not rely on neutron agent enablement to create $OVS_BRIDGE

Control nodes where n-cpu and q-agt aren't running,
but q-l3 is running, still require $OVS_BRIDGE to be present.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-June/096693.html

Change-Id: I8d30e4b8bf9caadca15c4497aed3711af33d371d

commit_message:
Ensures dns assignment is kept through VM creation

When booting a VM on a specified network, it should create a port and use
its name to create a fqdn (if configured to do so). This was not happening
because the dns information was being lost along the way. This patch ensures
the dns assignment is properly propagated.

Change-Id: Icf0d5198ad634bae182f8c279da05087c1ccbd3f
Closes-bug: 1579977

This reverts commit 16b12ba5b95e9696fa58719d671e9fe85e400ea8.

With the move to warehouse uploads in
Ib9d3d2bd02358947433aeb9520eb1bc1088392eb we no longer need these

commit_message:
Revert "Retry twine uploads in a loop"

This reverts commit 9ee3e76a66a9f5fd535de8031a7585dff6ea6f77.

Revert "Check twine uploads for success"

This reverts commit 16b12ba5b95e9696fa58719d671e9fe85e400ea8.

With the move to warehouse uploads in
Ib9d3d2bd02358947433aeb9520eb1bc1088392eb we no longer need these
check and retry workarounds for long-standing PyPI uploading
misbehavior. Also, per IRC discussion with Donald Stufft, those URLs
likely never worked the way we thought anyway.

Change-Id: I71ffcc0afadadb6c7233d49ea7941989b1f690ef

commit_message:
Do not allocate IPv6 SLAAC when IPv4 requested

When creating a nuetron port on a network that contains both an IPv4
subnet and a IPv6 SLAAC subnet, if the fixed_ip option is specified
requesting just the IPv4 subnet, an IP allocation from the IPv6 SLAAC
subnet should not be done.

Change-Id: Ic7cddddb94b3e4e8da969d5a8ea35aee4bc0994e
Closes-Bug: #1578281

subject: A resource list formatter for graphviz dot diagrams
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-30 21:15:37.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/resource_formatter.py', 'heatclient/tests/unit/test_resource_formatter.py', 'heatclient/tests/unit/var/dot_test.json', 'setup.cfg', 'heatclient/osc/v1/resource.py'], 'message': 'A resource list formatter for graphviz dot diagrams

This change registers a "dot" formatter for the stack resource list
command. It generates the text for a graphviz dot diagram which can be
rendered as an image with this example usage:

  openstack stack resource list --format dot -n3 my_stack | dot -Tsvg -o my_stack.svg

Nested resources are fully supported by creating nodes for top-level
resources then linking stack resources to a subgraph representing the
nested stack.

Change-Id: I4b899287eaf818137d60cb278db2d86598aa6794
'}]
commit_message:
A resource list formatter for graphviz dot diagrams

This change registers a "dot" formatter for the stack resource list
command. It generates the text for a graphviz dot diagram which can be
rendered as an image with this example usage:

  openstack stack resource list --format dot -n3 my_stack | dot -Tsvg -o my_stack.svg

Nested resources are fully supported by creating nodes for top-level
resources then linking stack resources to a subgraph representing the
nested stack.

Change-Id: I4b899287eaf818137d60cb278db2d86598aa6794

This change fixes all the markup issues in our docs, such as:

* Title length must match an underline (some titles are only 3
  characters long, make them longer, otherwise they are not
  considered a title);
* Blank line required after literal block;
* Duplicate explicit target name.

It also makes section names consistent in drivers.rst.

Change-Id: I058224589f4ca63a4acfb8e2c4fcdbb51c730542
'}]
commit_message:
Fix markup in documentation

This change fixes all the markup issues in our docs, such as:

* Title length must match an underline (some titles are only 3
  characters long, make them longer, otherwise they are not
  considered a title);
* Blank line required after literal block;
* Duplicate explicit target name.

It also makes section names consistent in drivers.rst.

Change-Id: I058224589f4ca63a4acfb8e2c4fcdbb51c730542

commit_message:
Added fault_tolerance_group to deployment metadata

This property contains list of groups, that is built from
tasks with type 'group' and each task may contain property
fault_tolerance, that shall be moved from openstack.yaml
to deployment tasks.
For plugins this attribute is filled from roles_metadata
for all tasks with type group (for backward compatibility).

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: 1435610
Change-Id: I1969b953eca667c09248a6b67ffee37bfd20f474

commit_message:
Copy devstack code to heat tree

This begins work toward moving the devstack code to a devstack plugin within
heat tree. This allows us to experiment with the devstack code more easily,
as well as take some load off of the devstack team.
Note that the plugin is not enabled until we enable it in project-config,
so this doesn't actually affect devstack runs yet. The files that exist in
devstack are listed below.

$ find . -name *heat*
./lib/heat
./files/apache-heat-api-cfn.template
./files/debs/heat
./files/apache-heat-pip-repo.template
./files/apache-heat-api-cloudwatch.template
./files/apache-heat-api.template

All of these files are copied to heat tree.

Change-Id: Ie7f16eff554e6cc2c62823cd49b6f726d96f25b4

commit_message:
Do not use cpu_map_update.py anymore

Because of the change [1], the file tools/cpu_map_update.py was removed,
and we rely on this file for gating.

However, according to the same review, this shouldn't be done anymore
because "nova has been fixed" (I've got no evidence of it yet).

This should fix the gate issue.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324562/

Change-Id: I83e3fc349a0448e0411f369bdf4888ff81cb37a8
Depends-On: I198db581db22655dc8791ba40a77a39b362c1b73
Closes-Bug: 1589440
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

commit_message:
add the undercloud_ip to the hostvars for the undercloud

This generally makes it easier to obtain the undercloud's
ip address in other roles or later in the workflow. The
undercloud's facts are not always gathered.

Change-Id: I7b8b57c17927fb3cf107c84c68f763e73659a2a9
